JobFullDesc: About the RoleWe are launching an exciting new team to focus on Payments and Financial products in the US&C. Our Operations lead will drive the development of critical insights, crafting strategies, and scaling the most nascent and innovative business initiatives to build the Financial Products business in the US&C market. This is particularly important as we improve current products and develop new business opportunities that require special attention (e.g. Driver Debit card) with innovative approaches to our payments strategy. This role will work closely with cross-functional counterparts and external parties to lead high impact initiatives across US&C while offering ownership and autonomy over your work. What you will doHelp craft, coordinate and lead Uber's strategy around Payments and Financial Products in the US&CData analysis: design, execute and automate processes to run and optimize the business performance and reliability. You will autonomously build your own analyses and dashboards to measure your projects' successExperiment: perform analysis and experiments to find growth opportunities for the New Verticals businessProcess & Tool Creation: One Operation team's biggest roles is to create processes and tools that enable us to be acutely informed of business performance to maximize the value of partnerships. Strategy: support the team lead on building a clear strategy on Financial Products, with a specific focus on bets that require strategic partnerships outside of directly working with the current relationshipsStakeholder management: an important cross-functional partner to teams working with broader payments, to ensure we craft relevant and adapted processes (CommOps, Legal, Comms, etc.)Interactions with Product teams: You will maintain links between on-the-ground teams and our internationally-based Product teams for everything we need to build on the Product front for our Payments and Financial Products: You will be the eyes and ears for the features that we need for next year's big bets, helping to prioritize future application changes, and you'll help launch all the new product features as we go to market  BASIC QUALIFICATIONS6+ years of professional work experience in a related field (consulting, operations, strategy, analytics, tech, investment banking)Strong SQL & Data analytics skills  (e.g., aggregation, generating insights, distilling large datasets into actionable recommendations)Demonstrated success in using data to make customer focused decisions and to facilitate behavior change in actioning and governing false positiveDistill vision and strategy for the team, get all partners of cross-functional team aligned and motivated PREFERRED SKILLS Prioritization - The individual will need to be a strong leader that is able to quickly prioritize and focus on the most important issuesBusiness Acumen - The issues on this team will be new to Uber as we build this business from the ground up. We will need a strong bias for action and business judgement as we navigate these difficult problem spaces.Ops Mindedness - We will need to experiment and hustle to build quickly. This individual will need to identify and evaluate solutions for short and long-term operational problems
